meanings.definition: Expressing or involving disapproval or condemnation.
meanings.sent1: Her reprobative glare made him realize he had made a mistake.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's reprobative comments on the student's behavior were clear.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a reprobative look when the dog stole its toy.
meanings.sent4: The judge's reprobative tone silenced the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds had a reprobative presence, warning of an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: His reprobative attitude towards new ideas hindered progress.
meanings.sent2: The company had a reprobative policy towards late submissions.
meanings.sent3: The reprobative cat refused to eat the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a reprobative air, discouraging visitors.
meanings.sent5: The reprobative sign at the entrance warned trespassers to stay away.
